page.title: 01Upland Limestone Area
page.content: Rugged limestone area in yorkshire dales national park with information centre. In Malham vilage, used by tourist and walker, crossed by pennine way and containing many caves and pot holes in addition to climbing on the gigantic limestone overhand of Malham cove. Gordale Scar wnhich is part of craven fault where waterfalls plunge down into a precipitous gorge. Sheep farming area used in past by fountains an furness abbey. Dairy farming also on upland fields but no crops are growen. Very small rural population but many visitors. Only one village of Malham with cafes gift shops etc.
